speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: Previously on the X-Files...

speaker: KERSH
line: You and AD Skinner are the two primary witnesses to Mulder's disappearance. I want your statement taken ASAP.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Taken by who?

speaker: KERSH
line: My task force leader on this, Special Agent John Doggett.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Look, if we knew where that ship was going we've got a chance to find Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It just came to me... why they took Mulder, why they're in Arizona. They're looking to find the whereabouts of a boy named Gibson Praise.

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: We've just confirmed a location on this kid. He's at a school for the deaf in a place called Flemingtown.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Keep an eye out the window. What are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Trying to find Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We live in a darkness of our own making... blind to a habitant world all but unseen by us. A world of beings traveling through time and space imaginable to us only as flights of fancy. Who are these beings we dare to imagine but fear to accept? What dark work goes on inside their impossible machines... cloaked from us by invisible forces? If they know our secrets, why can't we know theirs?

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: Stop it! Please! Let me go! Stop it! Let me go! Let me go!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let the boy go! Let him go, Mulder!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let him go, or I will be compelled to use my weapon. Now, I don't want to do that, Agent Mulder. I don't want to shoot.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Now, are you armed? Come on, damn it. This is just stupid, Agent Mulder. Don't turn this into a movie. Just tell me if you've got a gun. It's too hot for this B.S. All right, then, lie down. Lie down on the ground. Keep your hands out. Lay down on your belly there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: For crying out loud, what are you doing? Agent Mulder, stay there!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He went over! Over the edge!

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: Who?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder.

speaker: FEMALE AGENT
line: I have no explanation...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right, I'll talk to Scully. You guys head back to the school.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he? Where's Mulder?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't know? I heard an agent say over the radio that you saw him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oh, yeah, I saw him. I saw him back right off that cliff there and I saw him fall right over there.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then where is he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's gone.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Come on, he can't be gone.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, he can't be, but he is.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That cliff there? He fell from there? It's impossible... a fall like that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A cop sees things. A man drops five stories, dusts his head off and goes back to work. An old lady gets shot point-blank in a Chinese restaurant, plucks the slug out of her egg foo yung. But even if Mulder survives this, what he does then is too much. You got your point of impact there where Agent Scully is standing... clear and identifiable. And a set of tracks here leading down to the wash. Look at these tracks. What do you see?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder was running.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It wasn't Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's the one thing I'm sure of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It may have looked like Mulder, but it wasn't Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I told you I knew Mulder. Okay, maybe I didn't know him that well. But I know who it was up there, and it was Fox Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sure it did look like Mulder, and you have every reason to believe that it was him... but it was not Mulder. I told you that I've seen things... things that I can't explain. Well, I have seen what looks like a man … transform into another man.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What looks like a man, but who's not a man?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, what is he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't want to know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's not a man? What the hell is he? Hey, don't turn your back on me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm asking you a legitimate question.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's alien.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's a bounty hunter.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Looking to collect a bounty on...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: On Gibson Praise... because he's part alien. He's a human anomaly.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, this alien bounty hunter... he disguised himself as Mulder to come out here and grab the boy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To take him back to his ship... where we believe Mulder is.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, Agent Scully... you're, uh, you're starting to remind me a lot of Agent Mulder yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well then, you explain it to me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If it's true or possible, what you're saying-- that there's someone like this out there, this bounty hunter-- he could just become anyone. You, me, any damn one of us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think that it is true. And possible. And wherever Mulder is right now... he better damn well be smiling.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Is this authorized?

speaker: AGENT MOSLEY
line: Right. They're here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Any sign of him? Mulder?

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: Not according to these people. We went through the school.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're better than this.

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: Sir?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's got to be here somewhere. Let's search the school again.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hello?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sorry, I thought you were... I thought they cleared you out of here.

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: Find something?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. Let's keep looking.

speaker: VOICE ON RADIO
line: Administration building is clear.

speaker: AGENT  MOSLEY
line: Copy, check it again.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What I want to know is how Doggett got out here. How did he even know where we were going?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. But he's going to turn this place upside down looking for the wrong person.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What happened to Gibson Praise?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, whatever happened to him, he's long gone. Wherever he is, he's three steps ahead of us.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't look now but we've got a pair of eyeballs on us. Just start walking, I'll be right behind you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can I talk to you for a minute?

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: You shouldn't have come here.

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: You shouldn't have come. You'll lead them to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm here to protect you, Gibson.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know you know that's the truth. I know you know my thoughts.

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: I know they took the man you work with … Mulder. And now, they've come to take me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The only reason they want to take you, Gibson … is because you're a special boy. They want to take you because of what you are.

speaker: THEA
line: I'm sorry. I didn't know that someone was following me.

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: My friend Thea knows. She's the only one at school I've told. She says the FBI is looking for me, too. She's afraid for me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She has a right to be afraid. We don't know who to trust now.

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: I fell when I was running away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you might have broken it, Gibson.

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: If they find me, they'll take me. I know it. I've always known it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to make you a splint, Gibson, okay? I can set your leg, but, uh... I'm going to need a car to get you out of here. I'm going to come back for you. I promise. I'm not going to let anything bad happen to you.

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: You said that to me once before.

speaker: AGENT MOSLEY
line: Yeah?

speaker: AGENT MOSLEY
line: Deputy Director, for you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, this is John Doggett.

speaker: KERSH
line: Agent Doggett, I'm getting reports from Arizona...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: ...That you found Agent Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm afraid somebody jumped the gun on that. I saw him, sir, but I...

speaker: KERSH
line: What do you mean, you saw him? What the hell is going on out there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, we're 'round the clock here. I've got local SAR, a rolling ground cordon and an eye in the sky. We're on top of the situation.

speaker: KERSH
line: How does the FBI find a man and then lose him in the middle of the desert? 'Cause I'd like to know. Agent Doggett, are you there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. I heard the question.

speaker: KERSH
line: I put you in charge out there, Doggett. Now do the damn job.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This amuse you? I amuse you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. It just made sense to me. How you found your way out here. Who led you to Gibson Praise.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You think I was spying on you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, but I think our new Deputy Director was. You're being made a pawn in a rigged game.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, you've painted me the picture, now put it in a frame.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right. You've got a good rep, Agent Doggett. You don't compromise, you don't quit. You're a damned good FBI agent-- best of the best. Lot of guys put you in the Director's chair one day. Which is why you've been set up to fail. There's no amount of search and rescue or rolling cordons or eyes in the sky that are going to turn up Mulder. It's just the wrong approach.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's not a question of approach. It's the only approach I got.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The only way you're going to find Mulder is to give into the truth. To listen to Scully. But even then... say you did find him, even then you lose. You put anything about aliens or UFOs or alien bounty hunters in your report... Kersh will ruin you. I'm betting that was his plan.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is Agent Scully here? Where's Agent Scully?

speaker: AGENT MOSLEY
line: I need someone who's with Agent Scully to put her on a radio. Someone... with Agent Scully.

speaker: AGENT MOSLEY
line: Anyone got a twenty on Agent Scully? Is anyone out there with her?

speaker: AGENT LANDAU
line: I'm with Agent Scully.

speaker: AGNET MOSLEY
line: Then who's this?

speaker: AGENT LANDAU
line: Go for Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Give me the radio.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're with Scully?

speaker: AGENT LANDAU
line: Right across the room from her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From who? From me? Where?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What room? Where are you?

speaker: AGENT LANDAU
line: Bunkhouse. We're in the dorm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tell him to hold her. Tell them not to let her out of his sight!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hold Scully. We're coming to you.

speaker: AGENT LANDAU
line: Agent Scully--

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: There she is. Do you see her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where did she go? Did you see her?

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She ran right back here. I saw her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You saw her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent... Can you breathe?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He thinks it was me. He thinks that I did this to him. How is that possible?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's someone in this room.

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: Mulder!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully. Where are you going?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get out of the car.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who am I?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Drop your weapon and turn around.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I won't turn around.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just do it! I know how it works-- kill shot to the back of the neck.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully, you're pointing your weapon at a friend.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Turn around, or I'm going to assume that you're not who you say you are.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully, it's me! Skinner!

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can prove it. I know your secret-- who else knows it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay... then tell me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You tell me. How do I know it's you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't like pointing guns at pregnant women any more than I like them pointing guns at me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This has gone too far, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. That's what's wrong here. It hasn't gone far enough. I need those car keys.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And what do you think you're going to do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, we are being hampered here by the FBI, by John Doggett, by doubt, by our own mistrust. Whatever it is, it is working... as long as we let it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You told me Mulder wouldn't allow it. Wouldn't let me ruin my career over this. Over him. But what about you, Scully? I mean, my god, you've got even more at stake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I-I can't take the chance that I'm never going to see him again.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder could just come walking out of the dark-- we don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look... we've got one last chance here waiting for us out there in the desert-- Gibson Praise. It may just be who gets to him first.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get in the car. I'll drive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gibson!

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's not down there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told him to stay here. He was supposed to stay here. Gibson! I found him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gibson. What are you doing out here? Why didn't you answer me, huh?

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: He's here. I hear him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: Mulder. He's somewhere out there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's got a really bad fever. I think his leg might be infected.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, we got to get you to the hospital, okay, buddy?

speaker: GIBSON PRAISE
line: You're so close now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll carry you. Put your arm around my neck. Watch your legs.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You take him to the hospital.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What about you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I got a boy here who needs emergency medical attention.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What? Are you okay? What's wrong?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's okay, Gibson, lie down. Lie down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For someone who claims he's not following me, you sure have a knack.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey, you're where the action is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What does that tell you? That I'm crazy or that I'm right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Wandering around in the desert in the dead of night, you call it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You say you want to find Mulder but you won't do what it takes. You're afraid that I'm right.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm not afraid of anything. Except that maybe Mulder's got even you believing in this crap now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've seen this crap for yourself now. How do you explain what took place today?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let me ask you something hypothetically. Now, if you were to find him out here or this ship or this alien bounty hunter, what would you do then?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know what Agent Mulder would do. He'd do whatever it took.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You mean lie. Like you've been lying to me. And flout orders like you've done every step of the way on this thing. Is that what it takes, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Give a little, get a little, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You knew where the kid was, you knew where the kid was and you wouldn't tell me-- why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kid? I don't see any kid.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're lying to me again! Assistant Director Skinner took him from here to the hospital.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: There's one thing I know for sure in this case and that's that Mulder is after this boy Gibson Praise. Why? It beats the hell out of me. But when he goes after that kid, my men are going to be waiting for him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your men... followed Assistant Director Skinner?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey, where you going? Agent Scully, where you going?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your men are at the hospital?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They got it controlled. Nobody goes in or out of that building without them knowing about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know that they're your men?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully! Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's the boy?

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: Door at the end of the hall, with AD Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you certain about that?

speaker: AGENT MOSLEY
line: Why don't you get yourself a visual in the exterior window. The night nurse has been checking the boy every 20 minutes-- he's fine.

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: We have hospital personnel going about their business. We're just laying back, waiting for Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, every minute that you wait, that boy's in danger. He's exposed.

speaker: AGENT MOSLEY
line: No one's getting past us, Agent Scully. No one's gotten past us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You believe that, Agent Doggett?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, if something tries to rip your throat out, I got you covered.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A.D. Skinner... this is John Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell is this? What the hell is going on?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's no one in that room.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm looking for a patient, a boy, 12 years old. He may still be in this building.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The window doesn't even open. How's a grown man and a boy get out of the room except by that door?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's okay, I've got him. Gibson.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you get here? How did you get him out of that room?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We went up through the ceiling. I don't know who to trust.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's right here. They're going to find him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: An agent needs help!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I said an agent needs help!

speaker: KERSH
line: The best I can say is it's lucky it all happened at a hospital.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Very lucky, yes, Sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: I assume the hazardous materials or chemicals which caused this must have been medical.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That has not yet been determined, sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: So much here is undetermined... as remain the whereabouts of Mulder. But some of your … facts... like "a man falls from the cliff and disappears..." "An agent has his throat crushed by an assailant who vanishes into thin air." This reads like a piece of pot-boiled science fiction.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You mean it reads like an X-File. But that's what you intended, wasn't it, Sir? When you assigned me to the case.

speaker: KERSH
line: I'll ask the questions, John. You just give me some damn answers. Don't come back until you do.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: My dad always said it's not who wins or loses... it's who takes the worst beating that counts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That supposed to cheer me up?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I thought so. But then I never did get to see your opponent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you never will. You still don't believe me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What I don't believe is how long they're keeping you here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, it's just some things they have to check out... make sure of.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I've got some things I thought you'd want checked out. A.D. Skinner is in stable condition, resting comfortably and awaiting diagnosis and further study. Ditto Agent Landau, his throat. Gibson Praise is right now a ward of the state but I asked for special protections, as I assumed you would yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing here, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Keeping you apprised of the case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not your job.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It is, actually. And officially. I'm... assigned now to the X-Files.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Whatever you and I may differ on, I'll find him, Agent Scully.
